whatIs.title: What is a Digital Product Passport?
whatIs.intro: The Digital Product Passport (DPP) is a digital twin of a physical product that contains all relevant information about the entire lifecycle of the product.

transparency.label: Transparency:
transparency.description: Complete documentation of origin, materials, and manufacturing steps

sustainability.label: Sustainability:
sustainability.description: Tracking of CO2 footprint and environmental impacts

maintenance.label: Maintenance & Service:
maintenance.description: Documentation of maintenance history and technical specifications

practice.title: DPP in Practice
practice.description1: In the NextBike project, the DPP is realized through the Asset Administration Shell (AAS). The AAS enables the standardized digital representation of assets and their properties throughout the entire product lifecycle.
practice.description2: From the supplier through production to the end customer, all data is captured, linked, and made available through standardized interfaces. This enables complete traceability and creates the foundation for intelligent services and data-driven business models.

overview.title: Project Overview

valueChain.title: Complete Digital Value Chain
valueChain.description: The project demonstrates how a complete digital value chain can be represented using the Asset Administration Shell (AAS) - from suppliers through the parts catalog and configuration to production and the final Digital Product Passport (DPP).

predecessor.intro: The NextBike project builds on the findings and results of the following predecessor projects:

oi4.title: Open Industry 4.0 Alliance
oi4.description1: The NextBike project was developed under the leadership of the Open Industry 4.0 Alliance (OI4). The OI4 is a cross-manufacturer association that promotes open standards in Industry 4.0 and fosters interoperability between different systems and manufacturers.
oi4.description2: Through collaboration in the OI4 Alliance, it is ensured that the developed solutions are applicable industry-wide and comply with the latest standards.
